conclusion: A enters from the lower-left and is aimed on a gentle up-right diagonal. Its speed is low/medium, allowing it to push small cubes but stopping at the first medium or large block it meets.
The first block whose centre lies directly on the diagonal path is the small orange cube about one car-length in front of A.
The orange cube is lighter than the car, so it is kicked forwards a short distance.
The impact produces almost no sideways impulse, so the car’s nose continues on essentially the same line.
After the orange cube is pushed aside, the next obstacle on the same line is the green rectangular prism lying flat about 10–12 cm farther on.
The green prism is heavier and has a large face normal to the car’s motion.
The car strikes the near left edge of the green prism.
The prism’s mass is large enough that the car cannot push it out of the way.
Because the hit is slightly off-centre (left edge), a small counter-clockwise deflection is produced, but there is no room to swing past the block.
The green prism barely moves (a few millimetres).
The car’s wheels lose nearly all of their forward momentum in the second collision and it stops with its front bumper touching the long side of the green prism, slightly angled left.

A will first tap the small orange cube, pushing it ahead a little, then run straight into the green rectangular prism just beyond it. The car cannot shift that larger block and finally comes to rest with its nose against the near left edge of the green prism, a few centimetres above its initial diagonal path.
